job_title: Medical Imaging Assistant in Freeport, IL
pros: The environment is great and the people are amazing to work with. We all have a great work ethic and work together very well.
cons: I live 45 minutes away so the commute is the only con of working in Freeport.

review_title: Made me reconsider my passion for medicine.
job_title: Patient Care Technician in Freeport, IL
pros: -Choose your own schedule - Lot of people willing to help you learn new things and new skills. - Significant amount of in-house training and growth potential -Plenty of room to learn
cons: -Significantly understaffed/unhappy hateful workers. No not everybody was hateful but there were a significant amount of people that were cruel. I'm not somebody to back down on what I believe in or what I'm passionate about for anybody or anything. There is a bit of a gang mentality against new people everybody seems to have beef with everybody. It seems that some people are very willing to help and some people are going to make it very clear that you were in their way and that they are superior to you even if they are in your same position. A lot of demeaning disrespectful behavior. -Patient to tech ratio - Pay

pros: Compesated well for hard work
cons: Travels up to 50 miles one way

pros: There are no pros to working at FHN.

job_title: Customer Service Manager in Houston, TX
pros: none, the car industry is dying
cons: No room for advancement. Expensive benefits, no performance increases

review_title: Burn out is quick as they over work you
pros: Lots of experience as you do multiple jobs such as crisis assessments, oncall work, group home exams, home assessments and outpatient therapy
cons: Oncall work was on top of 40+ hour work weeks. If you worked a full oncall shift that meant you still come in the next day on no sleep. There were times I worked 30+ hours in a row. Many time we tried to fight for this to change as it was physically and mentally harmful. HR and management did not care at all. So much overturn of staff due to this.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Freeport, IL
pros: Allow you to move around within the organization to wherever their is an opening which gives you a lot of opportunity for variety and experiences.
cons: Management can feel disconnected and oblivious to the needs of individual departments always seeming to have an agenda of their own.

pros: Great opportunities to grow professionally
cons: Long hours, heavy workload, hard to staff.

review_title: I wouldn't bring my sick family to these people
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Freeport, IL
pros: they'll hire you on the spot
cons: Hours, they lack family compassion, they do not care if you're a single mom with no sitter. Management is a joke, pay is a joke. work a 12 hour shift and you'll get a great 20 minute break.

review_title: Another shortsighted health system concerned only with the bottim line
pros: Minimum competition from other health systems in the Freeport area.
cons: Poor management at many levels.  Truly a third class medical facility in all aspects.  Penny wise and dollar foolish.  Many of the "old guard management" hold outdated values that cause good people to leave and place the entire company in jeopardy.  Way too slow (and too cheap) to pick up on new technology and modern practices.  The competent people leave and mostly incompetent people remain.  A few very incompetent doctors remain on staff in key positions.

pros: Working in a hospital is Better than working in a nursing home. Some coworkers are friendly and fun to work with.
cons: They do not offer competitive pay, most places pay CNA's better. It can be very cliquey with lots of drama at times.

pros: Good health benefits and time off allowance
cons: low pay for CNA's with experience

pros: Good place to work for.
cons: Some of my co-workers attitudes.
